title: Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry cannot be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource
description: Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry cannot be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource. Therefore, all the resources that are being looked up are the only ones relative to the location of the FontRegistry class, org.eclipse.jface.resource path. It can be remedied if FontRegistry took a client class (or class loader) as an additional parameter to the constructor.
OB: When trying to create an instance of the FontRegistry for the application, a MissingResourceException is thrown. The code snippet used is as follows:com.company.product.MyClasspublic void createFontRegistry(){FontRegistry fonts = new FontRegistry("com.company.product.fonts");}
EB: Instead of directly instantiating the FontRegistry, if the ResourceBundle is used as shown in the code snippet below, no exception is thrown:com.company.product.MyClasspublic void createFontRegistry(){ResourceBundle fonts = ResourceBundle.getBundle("com.company.product.fonts");}
SR: When using the FontRegistry class from the org.eclipse.jface.resource package in com.company.product package, a MissingResourceException is thrown. However, if a complete copy of the FontRegistry class is created in the com.company.product package, it works. This suggests that there is a bug in the FontRegistry class.
